Kal_Hourd:
{{short description|Canadian country music singer-songwriter}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Kal Hourd | image = | caption = | image_size = | background = solo_singer | origin = [[Saskatoon, Saskatchewan]], Canada | instrument = | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer | years_active = 2007–present | label = [[E1 Entertainment|E1]] | associated_acts = | website = }} '''Kal Hourd''' (pronounced Hurd, born May 9) is a Canadian [[country music]] singer-songwriter. Hourd's debut album, ''Haven't Even Met Yet'', was released in August 2009 by [[E1 Entertainment]].{{cite web |url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/38138897/its_time_to_meet_kal_hourd_review_by/ |title=It's time to meet Kal Hourd |last1=Dedekker |first1=Jeff |last2=French |first2=Janet |date=2009-09-10 |publisher=[[The StarPhoenix]] |accessdate=2019-10-31 |location=Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, Canada }} == Career == Hourd grew up in [[Stockholm, Saskatchewan]]. He took up music when he was young as, unlike many of his friends, he was not athletic. He was encouraged to perform by [[Brad Johner]], whom he met and jammed with in 2001, and so he started entering talent quests. He began writing songs for his first album in 2006. In 2007, he won a rising star award at the 2007 Saskatchewan Country Music Association (SCMA) Awards.{{cite news |last1=Stewart |first1=Jeanette |title=Johner big winner at SCMA award show |url=https://www.newspapers.com/image/512884111/?terms=%22Kal%2BHourd%22 |work=Star-Phoenix |date=16 April 2007 |location=Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, Canada |page=2}} He released his debut album ''Haven't Even Met Yet'' in August 2009.{{cite journal |last1=MacPherson |first1=Alex J. |title=Lucky Break. How a chance meeting changed Kal Hourd's life |journal=Verb |date=December 7, 2012 |volume=R57 |pages=10–11 and cover |url=https://issuu.com/verb/docs/r57 |location=Regina, Saskatchewan, Canada}} It featured 12 songs, eight of which Hourd had co-written.{{cite news |last1=Dedekker |first1=Jeff |title=Hourd formulating a new plan |url=https://www.newspapers.com/clip/38139013/hourd_formulating_a_new_plan_by_jeff/ |accessdate=31 October 2019 |work=The Leader-Post |date=4 March 2010 |location=Regina, Saskatchewan, Canada |page=9}} Prior to the release of the album, Canadian astronaut [[Julie Payette]] asked for a copy of ''Haven't Even Met Yet'' to take with her on a mission to the [[International Space Station]], on the [[Space Shuttle Endeavour|Space Shuttle ''Endeavour'']].{{cite news |title=music to get weightless by |work=The Toronto Star |date=3 June 2009 |location=Toronto, Ontario, Canada |page=E2 |issn=0319-0781}}{{cite news |last1=Goodman |first1=Lee-Anne |title=Payette, Thirsk to make history in space |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/technology/payette-thirsk-to-make-history-in-space/article585522/ |accessdate=31 October 2019 |work=The Globe and Mail |date=July 8, 2009 |location=Toronto, Ontario, Canada}}{{cite news |title=Sask. musician in orbit over astronaut's support |url=https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/saskatchewan/sask-musician-in-orbit-over-astronaut-s-support-1.853007 |accessdate=31 October 2019 |work=CBC News |date=June 12, 2009}}{{cite news |title=Julie Payette emportera avec elle un peu de Saskatchewan dans l'espace |url=https://ici.radio-canada.ca/REGIONS/saskatchewan/Tele/Chroniques/index_1092_6_09.shtml |accessdate=31 October 2019 |work=Le Téléjournal Saskatchewan |date=3 June 2009 |language=French}} The same year, 2009, Hourd's single ''Beautiful Sound'', co-written by Missouri songwriter Deanna Harper, reached No 50 on the Canadian Country chart, his song ''When Pink Is Just a Color Again'' was chosen as the [[Pink Ribbon]] International official song,{{cite web |title=Music - Pink Ribbon Songs |url=http://pinkribbon.org/media-and-events/pink-ribbon-songs/ |website=Pink Ribbon |accessdate=31 October 2019}} and he won Video of the Year for ''When Pink Is Just a Color Again'' at the SCMA awards.{{cite web |title=2009 SCMA Award Winners |url=https://scma.sk.ca/past-awards/2009-scma-award-winners/ |website=Saskatchewan Country Music Association |accessdate=31 October 2019}} At the 2010 SCMA Awards, Hourd received awards for album of the year for ''Haven't Even Met Yet'', as well as single of the year and song of the year for ''Beautiful Sound''.{{cite news |title=Hourd, Prevost win big at SCMA awards |url=https://www.newspapers.com/image/498302339/?terms=%22Kal%2BHourd%22 |accessdate=31 October 2019 |work=The Leader-Post |date=20 April 2010 |location=Regina, Saskatchewan, Canada}} In 2012, ''When Pink Is Just a Color Again'' won him a second SCMA song of the year award.{{cite news |title=Prevost pulls off SCMA hat trick |url=https://www.newspapers.com/image/498774882/?terms=%22When%2BPink%2BIs%2BJust%2Ba%2BColor%2BAgain%22 |accessdate=31 October 2019 |work=The Leader-Post |date=24 April 2012 |location=Regina, Saskatchewan, Canada}} In 2016, he co-wrote the song ''Covered In Dust'' with Darlene Tuleta, who recorded the single and video.{{cite news |last1=Boz |title=Darlene Tuleta Interview & "Farm Fresh Song" |url=https://www.620ckrm.com/2016/04/25/boz-darlene-tuleta-interview-farm-fresh-song/ |accessdate=31 October 2019 |work=620 CKRM |date=April 25, 2016 |location=Regina, Saskatchewan, Canada}} Hourd was also leader of The Kal Hourd Band.{{cite news |last1=Dedekker |first1=Jeff |title=SCMA award nominees |url=https://leaderpost.com/entertainment/scma-award-nominees |accessdate=31 October 2019 |work=The Leader-Post |date=February 25, 2011 |location=Regina, Saskatchewan, Canada}} ==Discography==
